page.title: 20FARM SURVEY, THWAITES (2)
page.content:
Although none of the farms surveyed grow a significant quantity of crops, they all do grow grass for hay and silage. 80% grow grass for both purposes, 20% for one or the other. All the farms use the hay and silage they make themselves and do not sell any. Although the farms all deal in one type of livestock farming or another, there is no predominant breed of animal kept except for dairy cows which are mostly Fresian. Ulverston Auction is used for the sale of livestock by all of the farmers. 60% use Broughton as well, which is the nearest to our area, 20% use Kendal, and 10% use Lancaster. 70% of the farms keep hens. 20% of the farms make some butter from their milk.
THIS SURVEY WAS COMPILED BY THE CHILDREN OF THWAITES SCHOOL,NR.MILLOM.
